definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: Colorful ribbons are embellishing this world of variety.
sentences.chinese: 绚丽的彩带，点缀世界万象色彩。

sentences.english: They decorated the wedding car with ribbons and flowers.
sentences.chinese: 他们用彩带和鲜花装饰婚车。

sentences.english: Viewed from the top of the mountain, the three streams extend as so many ribbons.
sentences.chinese: 从山顶上望去，三条溪流伸展出去像三条彩带。

sentences.english: The ribbon was then tied back together and the ceremony continued.
sentences.chinese: 后来，人们把彩带绑起来，剪彩典礼继续进行。

sentences.english: Why use these ribbons and tags?
sentences.chinese: 为什么使用彩带和标签？

sentences.english: Can you catch all the ribbons on the maypole?
sentences.chinese: 能抓下五月柱上所有的彩带吗？

sentences.english: The ancient swing multi-purpose tree Lindera sticks to frame, then bolt on the ribbons made of.
sentences.chinese: 古时的秋千多用树桠枝为架，再栓上彩带做成。

sentences.english: The ribbon with which he had bound the wrists was broken; the hands were tightly clenched.
sentences.chinese: 他用来绑尸体手腕的彩带断了，她的手僵硬地紧握着。

sentences.english: Take holiday-colored ribbon and pin or glue it around the bottom of your lamp shade.
sentences.chinese: 把节日装饰彩带环绕着别在或者粘在灯罩的下方。

sentences.english: Play a game of strip anything, my favorite is strip billiards.
sentences.chinese: 玩个彩带游戏吧，我最爱彩带球。

sentences.english: Play a game of strip anything, my favorite is strip billiards.
sentences.chinese: 玩个彩带游戏吧，我最爱彩带球。

sentences.english: This paper reports 4 species of the subgenus Austronomia from China.
sentences.chinese: 报道中国澳彩带蜂亚属4种，并给出了物种检索表。

sentences.english: With the foam brush, cover the entire surface of the ribbon with craft glue.
sentences.chinese: 用泡沫刷蘸上滴胶，涂满整一条彩带的表面。

sentences.english: Will a virgin forget her ornament, or a bride her stomacher ?
sentences.chinese: 一位新娘岂能忘了自己的彩带？

definition: to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
bright and multicolored/of rich variety/(fig.) dazzling/glitzy
